title: Shia LaBeouf mistook PTSD caused by child stardom for alcoholism
text:
Shia LaBeouf first found fame at just 14 years old (Picture: Getty)

Shia LaBeouf revealed he mistook PTSD for alcoholism as he struggled to deal with his tough childhood and the pressures of becoming famous so young.

The actor, 33, shot to fame at just 14 years old after being cast as the main character, Louis Stevens, in Disney Channel show Even Stevens.

He has since revealed that he felt pressure to provide for his family from such a young age because he thought if he ‘had more money, there’d be no fighting’ between his parents and saw working as an ‘opportunity to be able to minimise the drama’.

Speaking on the Awards Chatter podcast by The Hollywood Reporter, Shia revealed that being under so much pressure from so young, led him to develop post-traumatic stress disorder, which he initially thought was just a drinking problem.

Shia admitted: ‘I was an ordinary kid, for real, in an extraordinary situation.’

He explained that his arrest in 2017 spurred him on to get therapy, which led to a diagnosis: ‘It was the first time I’d been told I had PSTD.

‘I just thought I was an alcoholic, like a true-blue drunk and I needed to deal with that.

Shia has written an autobiographical movie, Honey Boy, about his experiences (Picture: PA)

‘I knew it was an issue but didn’t know there was this extra whole other thing that was hindering my ability to have any peace in my life and my ability to deal with people.’

Shia has written a screenplay based on his experiences, called Honey Boy, which tells the story of ‘a young actor’s stormy childhood and early adult years as he struggles to reconcile with his father and deal with his mental health.’

As well as being based on his life experiences, Shia also stars as James Lort in the film, due to be released on 8 November.

The cast also includes singer FKA Twigs, Manchester By The Sea actor Lucas Hedges and Orange Is The New Black star Natasha Lyonne.

Honey Boy will be released on 8 November by Amazon Studios.
